response.answer_text: Spiritual rebirth has NOTHING WHATSOEVER in common with those stories about spirituality. All of them are connected with either a deity or the Universe. None of them focuses on YOU. Real spiritual rebirth starts with you and ends with you. YOU are the GOAL of it. You may make a certain impact on other people, the nature or even the Universe, but it is not THEM that your spirituality or your spiritual birth depends on. They are just the field, your spirituality will be manifested for a short time, as long as you are in this Reality. But spirituality is not about them, it doesn’t start with them, it doesn’t end with them, it isn’t focused on them and it doesn’t depend on them. Spirituality is not about A SPIRIT outside of you, that would lead you into a better life or a better future. No, spirituality is about YOU BECOMING A “SPIRIT”. Spirituality doesn’t mean that you are supposed to become one with SOMEONE ELSE - be it other people, God or the Universe. No, spirituality means that you are supposed to become one with YOURSELF. Not divided inwardly, as all people are from the moment on when they get born, but WHOLE. And that “whole” doesn’t mean a unity of body, Psyche and Spirit, but SPIRIT THAT CAN MANIFEST ITSELF THE WAY IT WANTS. Spirituality starts with YOU, is focused on YOU, and its goal is to make you capable of CREATING YOUR OWN INDIVIDUAL REALITY.

When target is reached there is no useful content left over to come down the life. Some people inspired by atma or Brahma or God, by his direction live to uplift the disciple only. This is like splitting the banana plant. reaching core this is like cutting mango fruit, reach to its seed. “sanyasta Khila Karmani Prasavandya Prayantnitah” sanyasi first become depregnated, means “aprasurvandya” in sankrit, means kills the seeds of this birth, as well as of future birth, once done the self or atma remains. it is like colorless light. he reaches the core of atma or Brahma. Once reached there, there is no taste, no sex, no desire, it is blank, no content. Once reached their the yogi die hanging there, with in twenty one days. for coming down from the core is called re-pregnancy, prasurvandya means holding greed of the creation and coming down to living.
